result.markdown: --- title: "Executive summary" --- The Net – Community Based Malaria Programme was implemented in Kilifi County, Kenya, between 2023 and 2025. This was in response to several concerns raised by the Kenya coastal health authorities regarding the fight against malaria. Some of the concerns raised include low usage and access to insecticide treated nets (ITNs), low adherence to Intermittent Preventive Treatment in pregnancy (IPTp), incorrect information about malaria, challenges in screening, diagnosis, and follow up and over-treatment of malaria. This project aimed to “Contribute to the achievement of the Sustainable Development Goal 3.3 By 2030, end the malaria epidemic and 3.8: Achieve Universal Health Coverage”. More specifically, the aim was to “Strengthen community-based malaria eradication mechanisms within Kilifi County, Kenya by 2024”. We expected to achieve these goals by implementing several activities: - prevention of transmission through raising awareness on use of bed nets - capacity building of CHPs and community case management officers - strengthening of data collection tools at community level and county monitoring mechanisms (Kenya Health Information System) This report aims to document the impact of The Net’s activities and their outcomes in Kilifi County, describe the acceptance and sustainability of the initiative by the beneficiaries and stakeholders. ### Study sites The map below shows the location of the 10 health facilities within the 5 sub-counties (**Ganze**, **Kaloleni**, **Kilifi North**, **Kilifi South**, **Rabai**) that participated in the study. Malindi and Magarini sub-counties shown in **gray** were not part of the study. ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](summary_files/figure-html/study-locations-1.png){width=576} ::: :::
